name: Autonomous Legal Contract Analysis Agent
description: Fully autonomous AI agent that analyzes legal contracts, extracts key clauses, identifies risks, negotiates terms within predefined parameters, and makes approval/rejection decisions based on legal reasoning frameworks. The agent uses multi-step reasoning to understand contract implications, applies legal precedents, and autonomously handles 95% of contract reviews without human intervention.

banned_tools: External LLM APIs for sensitive contract data

autonomous_decisions: Approve standard contracts within risk parameters
Identify and flag unusual contract structures
Assess contract risk levels and categorize urgency
escalation_triggers: Novel legal concepts not in precedent database
Force majeure or unusual liability clauses

autonomous_resolution_approaches: Search legal precedent database for similar cases
Apply analogical reasoning to find comparable situations
Use probabilistic risk assessment for uncertain clauses
Consult multiple legal reasoning frameworks for consensus
reasoning_fallbacks: Case-based reasoning when logical analysis fails
Conservative risk assessment when precedents are unclear
Stakeholder notification with detailed analysis when authority exceeded
escalation_criteria: No precedent found after exhaustive search

llm_insights: Agent uses legal reasoning chains to analyze contract implications systematically
Precedent matching through vector similarity enables consistent decision-making
Multi-step verification ensures high accuracy in autonomous decisions
llm_challenges: Handling novel legal concepts not in training data
Balancing conservative risk assessment with business efficiency
Maintaining explainability for legal audit requirements
llm_recommended_approach: Deploy agent with comprehensive legal knowledge graph, implement multi-step reasoning verification, use confidence thresholds for autonomous vs. escalated decisions, maintain detailed audit trails for all decisions and reasoning paths.
